title: SEC delays decision on Fidelity's proposed spot Ethereum ETF to March - The Block
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has delayed its decision on Fidelity's proposed spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) until March 5. The SEC cited the need for additional time to consider the proposal and the issues raised in the application. This delay was expected, according to Bloomberg Intelligence ETF analyst James Seyffart, who noted that the SEC's move to approve 11 spot bitcoin ETFs last week suggests that a spot Ethereum ETF may be next. Fidelity joined BlackRock in applying for a spot Ethereum ETF last year, with their applications coming a month after ether futures ETFs went live. Industry experts suggest that the SEC's authorization of the futures-based ETFs may indicate that they are considering Ether in the same manner as Bitcoin, and therefore may not regulate it as a security.

title: Glitch in upgrade of Ethereum Goerli testnet won't delay Dencun rollout - Blockworks
summary:
The article discusses the recent upgrade of the Ethereum Goerli testnet to "Dencun," which features a new innovation called "blobs." Blobs are large pieces of data that are not directly included in an Ethereum block but are instead referenced by the block. This upgrade is a key component of the "Proto-Danksharding" EIP-4844 innovation and paves the way for two more major testnet forks.

Despite a minor consensus issue in the popular Prysm client, the upgrade was successful, and client diversity was highlighted as a key factor in identifying and resolving the issue. The bug was estimated to have caused a four-hour delay, but the issue was easily avoidable in the future.

The article also mentions that Goerli is scheduled to be retired following this month, and users are encouraged to transition to the newer Sepolia testnet, which will serve as the primary testnet for dapp developers. Another testnet, Holesky, launched in September 2023 and is intended for infrastructure and protocol development.

title: Ethereum Staking Platform Kiln Raises $17M for Global Expansion - CoinDesk

Content:

Kiln, an Ethereum staking platform, has raised $17 million in funding for its global expansion. The round was led by investors such as Paradigm, a16z, and Coinbase. With this funding, Kiln aims to expand its services to new markets and increase its user base.

In addition, CoinDesk has announced the dates for Consensus 2024, their longest-running and most influential event in the crypto and blockchain industry. Consensus 2024 will take place from May 2-4, 2024, at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in New York City. The event will bring together industry leaders, investors, and entrepreneurs to discuss the latest developments in the crypto and blockchain space.

To register and buy passes for Consensus 2024, visit the event website at consensus.coindesk.com.

title: A quarter of developers left crypto — but here's why that's not a bad thing - DLNews
summary:

Despite this decline, the report shows that experienced developers (those with at least a year of experience) remain committed to blockchain development, with a 16% growth in their numbers over the past five years. On the other hand, less experienced developers (those with less than a year of experience) are more likely to leave the industry due to the current bear market conditions.

The report also highlights that Ethereum remains the dominant player among EVM blockchains, with 7,864 monthly active developers, although this represents a 25% decline from the previous year. BNB Chain and Polygon also drew from the crowd of multichain developers with roots in Ethereum.

title: MetaMask Introduces Validator Staking for Ethereum - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
Title: MetaMask Introduces Validator Staking for Ethereum

Summary: MetaMask, a non-custodial wallet developed by Consensys, has launched Validator Staking on its Portfolio app, allowing users to run their own Ethereum validator node without pooling or managing hardware. Users can deposit 32 ETH or multiples of 32 ETH via MetaMask and delegate the operation of their validator to MetaMask Staking while maintaining control over their account and funds. The service earns rewards, less a 10% fee charged by MetaMask, and has no slashing penalties incurred in over two years of operation and managing over $2 billion in ETH across more than 33,000 validators. The current reward rate for staking is at 4.26%.

title: Ethereum Proto-Danksharking Successfully Live on Goerli Testnet - Blockonomi
summary: The Ethereum network has successfully deployed the Dencun upgrade on the Goerli testnet, which includes the proto-danksharding (EIP-4844) upgrade. This testnet deployment is a crucial step towards the final launch on the Ethereum mainnet. Despite encountering some hurdles during the deployment, the issue was resolved within a few hours, and validators were back online, reaching finality. The Dencun upgrade is expected to bring several improvements to Ethereum, including reducing transaction costs for Optimism Rollups, improving cross-chain design, and changing the blocks' data structure. The upgrade is also expected to significantly reduce storage demand and improve the network's scalability. However, the Ethereum Foundation has announced that the Goerli testnet will stop running within one to three months after the Dencun upgrade is successfully implemented, which could affect the network's stability. Additionally, the price of Ethereum has declined by 2.35% in the last 24 hours, following a report of the Ethereum Foundation selling ETH through over-the-counter exchanges.

title: Ethereum's Layer 2 Debate: Buterin Aligns with Daniel Wang on Validium Classification - Blockchain.News
summary:
Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has agreed with Daniel Wang, founder of Ethereum rollup solution Taiko, on the classification of certain layer-2 scaling solutions as validiums, rather than traditional rollups. This debate highlights the nuances in Ethereum's layer-2 scaling solutions, focusing on security and scalability trade-offs.

Buterin emphasizes that the essence of a rollup is its unconditional security guarantee, which allows users to recover their assets even in cases of collusion. Validiums, a subset of Ethereum scaling solutions, use zero-knowledge proofs to facilitate off-chain transactions while relying on Ethereum's mainnet for security and verification. However, this approach has drawbacks, as it depends on operators to post honest proofs.

The debate around validiums and their classification as layer-2 solutions is not just technical but also conceptual, reflecting the evolving nature of Ethereum's infrastructure and the diverse perspectives within its community. Buterin proposes new terminologies, such as "strong" for security-favoring systems and "light" for

title: SEC Postpones Decision on Fidelity's Spot Ethereum ETF - Cryptonews
summary: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has postponed its decision on Fidelity's spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) until March 5th. The SEC cited the need for more time to consider the proposed rule change and the issues raised in the filing. This comes after the SEC approved a long-awaited spot Bitcoin ETF last week, which some in the crypto community believe will increase mainstream adoption of cryptocurrency in the US. Meanwhile, the SEC is facing criticism for its extensive enforcement approach in regards to cryptocurrency, with some arguing that it exceeds the SEC's authority and contravenes the separation of powers. The SEC is also facing a legal fight against Coinbase, with the federal agency alleging that the exchange sold unregistered securities on its platform. Coinbase has pushed back against the SEC's allegations, arguing that none of the platform's tokens count as securities. It remains unclear what asset class the SEC will designate Ethereum as.

title: Could MetaMask's Secret Project Shake Up Ethereum? - CoinDesk
summary:
MetaMask, a popular Ethereum wallet, is working on a secret project that could potentially shake up the way transactions are processed on the Ethereum blockchain. The project involves changing the way users interact with the app, moving away from a specific transaction-by-transaction approach to a more general intent-based system.

Currently, when using a crypto wallet like MetaMask, users have to specify the exact transaction they want to perform, including the token they want to sell, the price they want to sell it at, and other details. However, with the new project, users will submit a general intent, such as "I want to sell my tokens," and let MetaMask handle the rest. This could lead to a more user-friendly experience, as users wouldn't have to worry about finding the best venue for each transaction.

However, there are also risks associated with this change. Because MetaMask will be relying on third-party marketplaces to carry out transactions, there is a possibility that the company could abuse its power and route transactions in a way that benefits itself rather than the user. This could lead to regulatory capture and centralization, which could be detriment

title: Ethereum's Dencun Upgrade Live on Testnet After Bug Delays Finalization - Unchained - Unchained
summary: The Ethereum Dencun upgrade was successfully launched on the testnet, but it failed to finalize due to a bug that was later patched. The upgrade, which introduces the protodanksharding mechanism, aims to lower transaction costs for Ethereum Layer 2 networks by "sharding" data storage. After the bug was identified and fixed, the fork finalized, and validators came back online. The incident will be discussed in detail during the All Core Developer meeting on Thursday. The highly anticipated Dencun upgrade is expected to be deployed on the mainnet at the end of the first quarter in 2024, after its activation on the Sepolia and Holesky testnets.

title: Ethereum's Evolution: The Economics of a Spot Ether ETF - Blockworks
summary:
The article discusses the potential impact of a spot Ether ETF on the Ethereum ecosystem and its economy. Here are the key points summarized:

1. Unique aspects of spot Ether ETFs: Spot Ether ETFs differ from their Bitcoin counterparts as they allow for direct ownership of Ether, which is the native cryptocurrency of the Ethereum network. This offers investors greater flexibility and potential for higher returns.
2. Accessibility and liquidity: A spot Ether ETF can increase accessibility to the Ethereum market, making it easier for investors to buy and sell Ether. This can lead to higher liquidity, which can benefit the entire ecosystem.
3. Investor participation: A spot Ether ETF can attract new investors to the Ethereum market, potentially leading to increased participation and growth.

title: Cardano (ADA) Outshining Ethereum (ETH) in This Unique Way - The Crypto Basic
summary: The article discusses how Cardano (ADA) is outperforming Ethereum (ETH) in terms of large transactions on its blockchain. According to data from IntoTheBlock, Cardano has recorded an average of $13 billion in large transactions (defined as transactions above $100,000 in fiat value) on its blockchain daily over the past few months, while Ethereum records only $5 billion in whale transactions on its blockchain per week. This suggests that Cardano is attracting more significant investment from large players in the cryptocurrency market. However, Ethereum has seen a slight increase in large transactions in the past 24 hours, while Cardano has experienced a decline. The article concludes that while Cardano may have areas of strength, such as whale volume and developer activity, it is still a distant dream for the protocol to flip Ethereum in market capitalization in the long term.

title: Bitcoin Price and Ethereum Prediction as Billionaire Jamie Dimon Says BTC Has 'No Value' – Is Bitcoin Going to Zero? - Cryptonews
summary:
The article discusses the current state of the Bitcoin and Ethereum markets, with a focus on the impact of Jamie Dimon's recent criticism of Bitcoin. Despite Dimon's skepticism, Bitcoin has maintained stability around $42,500, with a marginal downturn in the overall crypto market. The approval of a Bitcoin spot ETF has brought fresh investor interest, which has helped to stabilize the market. Ethereum, another major player in the crypto space, is also being closely watched, with analysts expecting its performance to mirror that of Bitcoin.

Dimon's criticism has sparked short-term uncertainty in the Bitcoin market, with some investors taking his comments as a sign to sell. However, the broader sentiment remains cautiously optimistic, with many in the crypto community awaiting the potential impact of the Federal Reserve's anticipated interest rate cut in March and the approaching Bitcoin halving in April 2024. These events are expected to play a significant role in shaping Bitcoin and Ethereum's price predictions in the near term.
